net.librec.recommender

Class AbstractRecommender

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.librec.recommender.AbstractRecommender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Recommender
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AssociationRuleRecommender, ConstantGuessRecommender, ExternalRecommender, FactorizationMachineRecommender, GlobalAverageRecommender, HybridRecommender, ItemAverageRecommender, ItemKNNRecommender, MatrixFactorizationRecommender, MostPopularRecommender, NMFRecommender, PersonalityDiagnosisRecommender, ProbabilisticGraphicalRecommender, RandomGuessRecommender, RBMRecommender, SLIMRecommender, SlopeOneRecommender, UserAverageRecommender, UserKNNRecommender

    public abstract class AbstractRecommender
extends java.lang.Object
implements Recommender
    Abstract Recommender Methods
    Author:
    WangYuFeng and Wang Keqiang

      • predict

        protected abstract double predict(int userIdx,
             int itemIdx)
                           throws LibrecException
        predict a specific rating for user userIdx on item itemIdx, note that the prediction is not bounded. It is useful for building models with no need to bound predictions.
        Parameters:
        userIdx - user index
        itemIdx - item index
        Returns:
        predictive rating for user userIdx on item itemIdx without bound
        Throws:
        LibrecException - if error occurs during predicting

      • predict

        protected double predict(int userIdx,
             int itemIdx,
             boolean bound)
                  throws LibrecException
        predict a specific rating for user userIdx on item itemIdx. It is useful for evalution which requires predictions are bounded.
        Parameters:
        userIdx - user index
        itemIdx - item index
        bound - whether there is a bound
        Returns:
        predictive rating for user userIdx on item itemIdx with bound
        Throws:
        LibrecException - if error occurs during predicting

      • isConverged

        protected boolean isConverged(int iter)
                       throws LibrecException
        Post each iteration, we do things:
        1. print debug information
        2. check if converged
        3. if not, adjust learning rate
        Parameters:
        iter - current iteration
        Returns:
        boolean: true if it is converged; false otherwise
        Throws:
        LibrecException - if error occurs
